remarks.para: A represents an vstecmsbuild project. It is a container for items, properties and targets. It can load project content from in-memory XML or from an XML file, and can save to an XML file, preserving most whitespace and all XML comments.
Every must be associated with an to access shared information. During a build, the object keeps track of which projects are currently building.

summary.para: Represents a project that can be built using vstecmsbuild.
Initializes a new instance of the class.
Initializes a new instance of the class using the supplied .

Docs.param: The instance to use for creating the project in memory.

summary.para: Add an Import element to the end of the project.

remarks.para: This method attempts to add the item to the project near the other items in the item collection.

summary.para: Adds the specified Item element to the project.

The value of the Include attribute of the item.

true to treat the parameter as a literal value; otherwise, false.

summary.para: Adds a new UsingTask element with the specified assembly file.

Docs.param: The name of the task to reference from the assembly. Corresponds to the TaskName attribute of the UsingTask element.
The file path to the assembly. Corresponds to the AssemblyFile attribute of the UsingTask element.

summary.para: Adds a new UsingTask element with the specified assembly name.

Docs.param: The name of the task to reference from the assembly. Corresponds to the TaskName attribute of the UsingTask element.
The name of the assembly to load. Corresponds to the AssemblyName attribute of the UsingTask element.

summary.para: Builds the default targets of the project.

returns.para: true if the build was successful; otherwise, false.

summary.para: Builds the specified target in the project.

returns.para: true if the build was successful; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: The target to build.

summary.para: Builds the specified list of targets in the project.

returns.para: true if the build was successful; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: The list of targets to build. This parameter can be a null reference (Nothing in vbprvb) to build the default targets.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Build (string[] targetNames, System.Collections.IDictionary targetOutputs);

summary.para: Builds the specified list of targets in the project, and returns the outputs of the targets.

returns.para: true if the build was successful; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: The list of targets to build. This parameter can be a null reference (Nothing in vbprvb) to build the default targets.
The outputs of the built targets. This parameter can be a null reference (Nothing) if outputs are not needed.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Build (string[] targetNames, System.Collections.IDictionary targetOutputs, Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildSettings buildFlags);

summary.para: Builds the specified list of targets in the project using the specified settings, and returns the outputs of the targets.

returns.para: true if the build was successful; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: The list of targets to build. This parameter can be a null reference (Nothing in vbprvb) to build the default targets.
The outputs of the built targets. This parameter can be a null reference (Nothing) if outputs are not needed.
The to apply to the build.

remarks.para: By default, this property uses value of the property of the project's .

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the project is enabled for building tasks and targets.
Gets or sets the DefaultTargets attribute of the Project element in the vstecmsbuild project.
Gets the encoding for the project file.

remarks.para: The returned contains all the evaluated items in the project after wildcard and property expansion. The items in this property represent the actual items used during the build process. This property value is generated every time something in the project changes. Changes to existing items in this collection will be reflected the next time the project is saved, but adding or deleting items will not impact the project.

summary.para: Gets a collection of the items evaluated during the build.

remarks.para: The returned contains all items in the project after wildcard and property expansion, including those that were not used during the build process due to Condition attributes evaluating to false. This property value is only generated when certain changes occur, such as a new Import element being added to the project. Adding or deleting items from this property does not impact the project.

summary.para: Gets a collection of all items in a project, even those not used in the build process because a Condition attribute evaluated to false.

remarks.para: The returned contains all the evaluated properties in the project after performing condition evaluation and property expansion. The properties in this collection include global properties, environment variables, reserved properties, and imported properties. Changes to existing properties in this collection will be reflected the next time the project is saved, but adding or deleting properties will not impact the project.

block.para: Cloning a can negatively impact performance. Only use a copy of this property when it is strictly necessary.

summary.para: Gets a collection of the properties evaluated during the build.

remarks.para: This property is an empty string if the project does not have a file associated with it.

summary.para: Gets or sets the fully qualified path and file name of the project file.

remarks.para: This method generates the list of possible values by inspecting all of the Condition attributes in the project that involve the property.

summary.para: Returns a list of possible values for the specified property.

returns.para: The list of possible values for the property.

Docs.param: The property to use when generating the list of possible values.

summary.para: Returns all evaluated items belonging to the specified item collection.

returns.para: A containing all of the evaluated items belonging to the specified item collection.

Docs.param: The name of the item collection.

summary.para: Returns all items belonging to the specified item collection.

returns.para: A containing all items belonging to the specified item collection, even those not used in the build process because a Condition attribute evaluated to false..

Docs.param: The name of the specified item collection.

remarks.para: If you need to retrieve a large number of property values, use the property.

summary.para: Returns the value of the specified property.

returns.para: The value of the specified property.

Docs.param: The name of the property.

summary.para: Returns a string value of the XML from the specified element in the ProjectExtensions element.

returns.para: The string value of the specified element in the ProjectExtensions element of the project.

Docs.param: The name of the element in the ProjectExtensions element to return.

remarks.para: Global properties are properties set with the /property switch on the command line, or properties set by the integrated development environment before invoking vstecmsbuild. For more information, see MSBuild Command Line Reference.

summary.para: Gets or sets a collection of the global properties for the project.

remarks.para: Imported projects are specified by the Import element in the project.

summary.para: Gets the projects imported into this project.
Gets or sets the InitialTargets attribute of the Project element in the vstecmsbuild project.
Gets a value indicating whether the project has changed and needs to be saved to a file.
Gets a value indicating whether the project is to be validated against a schema.

remarks.para: The returned by this property contains the item groups in this project and all imported projects.

summary.para: Gets a collection of the item groups specified with the ItemGroup element in the project.
Loads the contents of the specified into the object.

summary.para: Loads the contents of the specified project file into the object.

summary.para: Loads the contents of the specified string into the object.

summary.para: Sets the property of the project to true.
Gets the that builds the project.

remarks.para: The returned by this property contains the property groups in this project and all imported projects.

summary.para: Gets a collection of the property groups specified with the PropertyGroup element in the project.
Removes all item groups from the project, but does not modify imported projects.
Removes all property groups from the project, but does not modify imported projects.
Removes the specified item from the project.

Docs.param: The item to remove from the project.

summary.para: Removes the specified item group from the project.

Docs.param: The item group to remove from the project.
To be added.

summary.para: Removes all item groups with the specified condition from the project, but does not modify imported projects.
Removes all items in the specified item collection from the project, but does not modify imported projects.

Docs.param: The item collection to remove.

summary.para: Removes the specified property group from the project.

Docs.param: The property group to remove from the project.

summary.para: Removes all property groups with the specified condition from the project, but does not modify imported projects.

Docs.param: The condition to match when removing property groups.

summary.para: Resets the status every target in the project so that the next build will build all targets again.

Docs.param: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetProperty (string propertyName, string propertyValue, string condition, Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.PropertyPosition position);

remarks.para: is called from the integrated development environment (IDE) to set a particular property at the project level. This method searches the existing property groups for a property with this name. If one is found, it changes its value. Otherwise, it either adds a new property to that property group, or adds a new property group to the project. uses the parameter to determine the name of the property group place it in.

Docs.param: The name of the property to change.

The condition to use on the property. Corresponds to the Condition attribute of the Property element.
A value indicating the location to insert the property.
